BKFC Launches Ice Wars: Unique Combat Sports Event in 2025
BKFC launches Ice Wars, a unique combat sports series featuring on-ice fights without hockey. Scheduled for June 14 at Soaring Eagle Casino in Michigan and a subsequent event in Alberta, Canada, it will showcase fighters in a special ice enclosure called "The Ice Box." Participants will compete in rounds of 90 seconds, donning hockey gear and MMA gloves. BKFC President David Feldman emphasizes the shared vision of both promotions to bring high-energy sports to a wider audience.
By the Numbers- Two scheduled events in 2025: June 14 in Michigan and another in Alberta.
- Six events planned for 2025, with a goal of 24 in 2026.
- Ice Wars has attracted a dedicated fan base since its inception in 2022.
- The promotion will feature four weight classes: Heavyweight, Cruiserweight, Middleweight, and Lightweight.
Excitement builds for the inaugural Ice Wars event, with fans anticipating more details on streaming and match formats. The success of this initial event will likely dictate the franchise's expansion plans for 2026.
Bottom LineIce Wars stands to redefine combat sports on an international scale, merging BKFC's expertise with innovative ice fighting. This partnership could ignite a new wave of adrenaline-fueled entertainment in the industry.
